Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant that looks healthy when it has water, showing lush green leaves and strong stems.
The student can accurately depict a plant that appears unhealthy or wilting due to lack of water, with droopy, brown leaves.
The student can include detailed elements like raindrops and dry, cracked earth to indicate presence and absence of water.
The student can successfully show a comparison by placing a healthy, vibrant plant and an unhealthy, wilting plant side by side.
The student can effectively use color to differentiate between the vibrant, healthy plant and the dull, unhealthy plant, using greenery and browns to show health levels.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally forget to label or provide minimal explanation for their illustrations, assuming details are self-evident. (e.g., not labeling 'with water' and 'without water')
The student might not perfectly balance plant characteristics in each scenario, such as slightly subdued color vibrancy in the healthy plant. (e.g., less vibrant than intended)
